qas.question: In what year was the Estado Novo established?
How many European countries remained neutral throughout World War II?
What action affirmed Portugal's status as a transcontinental nation?

answers.text: relocation of mainland Portuguese citizens into the overseas provinces in Africa

context: This in turn led to the establishment of the right-wing dictatorship of the Estado Novo under <a0_0>António de Oliveira Salazar<a0_0/> in <a1_0>1933<a1_0/>. Portugal was one of only <a2_0>five<a2_0/> European countries to remain neutral in World War II. From the 1940s to the 1960s, Portugal was a founding member of NATO, OECD and the European Free Trade Association (EFTA). Gradually, new economic development projects and <a3_0>relocation of mainland Portuguese citizens into the overseas provinces in Africa<a3_0/> were initiated, with Angola and Mozambique, as the largest and richest overseas territories, being the main targets of those initiatives. These actions were used to affirm Portugal's status as a transcontinental nation and not as a colonial empire.
